intro: Oxytropis babatagi, commonly known as the Babatag legume, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and trifoliate leaves composed of three oval-shaped leaflets. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically pale blue or purple in color. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Oxytropis babatagi is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions.
